intro: Centaurea sicana, commonly known as the Sicilian centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers. Its botanical features include a hairy stem and bracts that surround the central flower cluster. Centaurea sicana is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in full sun.
